intro: Rabdosia amethystoides, commonly known as purpleleaf rabdosia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its striking purple foliage and clusters of small, tubular flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Rabdosia amethystoides is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant color and ornate flowering structure.
